trans-unit.source: Serves as the base class for all ASP.NET mobile Web Forms pages.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The MobilePage class inherits from the ASP.NET <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class.
To specify a mobile page and use ASP.NET mobile controls, an ASP.NET mobile Web Forms page must contain the following page directive.
``` <%@ Page Inherits="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage" Language="c#" %> ``` The `Inherits` attribute is required.
The `Language` attribute is set to the language that is used on the page, if it is needed.
> [!NOTE] > ASP.NET mobile pages allow for multiple mobile forms on each page, whereas ASP.NET Web pages allow for only one form per page.
Creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Gets a rooted URL to the current page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A rooted URL is absolute with regard to the server, but it is not a complete URL because it does not include the protocol prefix or server name.
A rooted URL to the current page.
Gets or sets the page's currently active form.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
When a page is initially rendered, the first form in the page is automatically made active.

On subsequent postbacks, another form might be made active, either by programmatically setting this property, or as a result of user navigation through a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Link> control.
The page's currently active form.
The page does not contain any forms.
Gets the device-specific adapter for the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The device-specific adapter for the control.
Called after a control is added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls*> collection.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.AddedControl%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to determine whether the control is a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form> or a <xref:System.Web.UI.UserControl> before it calls the base method.
If the control is a `Form` or a `UserControl` object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.Forms%2A> property is set to `null`.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl"></xref> that has been added.
The index of the control in the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Controls" name="Controls" href=""></xref> collection.
Notifies the page that an element was parsed, and adds the element to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls*> property.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Unless you override it, this method automatically adds <xref:System.Web.UI.LiteralControl> objects to the server control's <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlCollection> object.
This collection can be accessed through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A> property.

This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.AddParsedSubObject%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to determine whether the object is a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> before it calls the base method.
If the object is of type `StyleSheet`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.StyleSheet%2A> property is set to the `o` parameter.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the parsed element.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.StyleSheet*> property has already been set.
Gets a value indicating whether controls on the page can have custom attributes defined.

The default value is the value of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_allowCustomAttributes" name="allowCustomAttributes" href=""></xref> attribute of the <<xref uid="langword_csharp_mobilecontrols" name="mobilecontrols" href=""></xref>> section of the Web.config file.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

In addition to the <xref:System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor> interface, the ASP.NET page framework provides a `CustomAttributes` dictionary that allows you to specify additional attributes, enable or disable custom attributing, or adjust a control's behavior or rendering.

To enable or disable custom attributing, you can either set the AllowCustomAttributes property to `true`, or you can set the `allowCustomAttributes` attribute of the <`mobileControls`> section of Web.config to `true`.
> [!NOTE] > When custom attributes are enabled, typographic errors in property names can be interpreted as custom attributes.

For example, if a developer incorrectly specifies the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property of a control as "Txet", the parser would save it as a custom attribute called "Txet" instead of raising an exception.
For this reason, custom attributes are disabled by default.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the controls on the page can have custom attributes defined; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the view-state information, which combines private view state and an identifier for application view state, to write to the client in encoded form.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The view-state information, which combines private view state and an identifier for application view state.
Creates an <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object to render the page's content.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The type of writer created is determined by the adapter associated with the current mobile device.
For more information about how to map adapters to devices, see [Adapter Mappings](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/8437a6a5-855c-4637-8654-75a87b293847).
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter> used to create the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref>.

An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> or a text writer derived from <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref>, such as <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ChtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref>, or <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the page is being instantiated in design mode or at run time.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the page is being instantiated in design mode; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Determines the type of request made for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage"></xref> class and returns a <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> of data posted back to the page by using either a POST or a GET command.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.DeterminePostBackMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to determine whether the page was requested because of a transfer or a redirect.
If so, `null` is returned.
Otherwise, the `DeterminePostBackMode` method of the adapter is called.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> object that contains the form data.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities"></xref> object for the current requesting device.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This property is provided for convenience, and is equivalent to obtaining browser information from the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest> object, such as `Page.Request.Browser`.
The <xref href="System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities"></xref> for the current requesting device.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether postback event data should be validated.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
ASP.NET controls create client-side scripts to raise postback events on the server.
It is possible for a malicious user to use the postback script to send arbitrary post events to server controls.
For this reason, ASP.NET version 2.0 controls validate the event data to ensure that the event was raised by client-side code rendered by the control.
Event validation is not supported in mobile pages.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
An attempt was made to set this property.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether themes apply to this page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Themes are not supported on mobile pages.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
An attempt was made to set this property.
The value of this property cannot be changed.
Gets the collection of forms on the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage"></xref> object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The collection of forms that is contained in the page.
Creates and returns a new device-specific adapter for the specified control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is called internally by ASP.NET.
The control to which the device-specific adapter is attached.
A new device-specific adapter for the specified control.
Returns the form object specified by the ID parameter.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Each form has a string identification number associated with it.
When you supply the ID of a form on the page, this method returns the corresponding <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form> object.
The identifier of the form to return.
The specified form object.
If no such form exists, GetForm throws an exception.
The requested form was not found.
Retrieves the view state for the control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A control's view state is the aggregation of all its non-default property values.
The control for which the state is retrieved.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object associated with the control.
Retrieves whether the page has any hidden variables defined.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the page has any hidden variables defined; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Contains the identifier to use for the hidden field in the postback argument.
This field is read-only.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Adapters use this field to render postbacks.
To be added.
Contains the source identifier to use to render the hidden field for the postback source.
This field is read-only.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Adapters use this field to render postbacks.
To be added.
Returns the prefix to use to render hidden variables.
This field is read-only.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
To be added.
Gets a dictionary of hidden variables on the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage"></xref> object.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A dictionary of the hidden variables that is contained in the page.
Gets the character that is used to separate control identifiers when building a unique ID for a control on a page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

This member overrides <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.IdSeparator%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to return a colon (:) if the adapter is a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPageAdapter> or <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlPageAdapter>.
Otherwise, it returns the default character.
The character that is used to separate control identifiers.
The default is set by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Adapters.PageAdapter"></xref> instance that renders the page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.IdSeparator*> property is a server-side field and should not be modified.
Initializes the output cache for the current page request.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.InitOutputCache%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to add more `VaryByHeader` keywords to provide correct caching of page output for different markup devices.
The amount of time that objects stored in the output cache are valid.
A semicolon-separated list of headers that content from the output cache will vary by.
The <xref uid="langword_csharp_Vary" name="Vary" href=""></xref> HTTP header.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.OutputCacheLocation"></xref> values.
A semicolon-separated list of parameters, received by a GET or POST method, that content from the output cache will vary by.
Initializes the output cache for the current page request.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.InitOutputCache%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to add more `VaryByHeader` keywords to provide correct caching of page output for different markup devices.
The amount of time that objects stored in the output cache are valid.
A semicolon-separated list of character-sets (content encodings) that content from the output cache will vary by.
A semicolon-separated list of headers that content from the output cache will vary by.
The <xref uid="langword_csharp_Vary" name="Vary" href=""></xref> HTTP header.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.OutputCacheLocation"></xref> values.
A semicolon-separated list of parameters, received by a GET or POST method, that content from the output cache will vary by.
Loads any saved view-state information to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.LoadPageStateFromPersistenceMedium%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method and optimizes the state data for mobile devices.
An object containing the saved view state.
Internally, this is typically a <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> or <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object.
Restores view-state information from a previous page request that was saved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.SaveViewState*> method.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is primarily used by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state.
For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.LoadViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method and saves any existing adapter state with the view state in an object array.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the page state to be restored.
Converts the specified relative URL into an absolute URL.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Absolute URLs differ depending on whether the application is configured for cookieless session management.
This method provides a single way to translate application URLs regardless of the cookie setting.
The relative URL to be converted.
The absolute path corresponding to the specified virtual path.
Gets or sets the file name of the master page.
Master pages are not supported in ASP.NET mobile Web Forms pages.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member overrides <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.MasterPageFile%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to prevent master pages from being used.
This is because master pages are not supported on ASP.NET mobile Web Forms pages.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
An attempt was made to set this property.
Master pages are not supported on mobile pages.
Called after the page is initialized.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
You can override this method to set device-specific properties.
If you override this method in an inheriting class, you must call the base implementation.
An object defined by an <xref:System.EventArgs> object that contains event data.
Handles the <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplication.Error"></xref> event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.TemplateControl.OnError%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to allow the adapter to handle the error.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> object that contains the event data.
Handles the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Init"></xref> event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.OnInit%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to customize the event data for the adapter.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> object that contains the event data.
Handles the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Load"></xref> event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.OnLoad%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to customize the event data for the adapter.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> object that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page.PreInit"></xref> event at the beginning of page initialization.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.OnPreInit%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to customize the event data for the adapter.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> object that contains the event data.
Handles the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.PreRender"></xref> event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.OnPreRenderComplete%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to customize the event data for the adapter.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> object that contains the event data.
Handles the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.Unload"></xref> event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.OnUnload%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to customize the event data for the adapter.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> object that contains the event data.
Handles an exception caused by an expired view state on postback.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
If you expect to restore a page from a view state, and the page's underlying session has expired, this method's default implementation raises an exception.
You can override this method, perform custom handling to restore the page state without relying on view state, and return without calling the base implementation.
An object defined by an <xref:System.EventArgs> object that contains event data.
The session state has expired.
-or- The session cookie from the client is invalid.
-or- The session state history has exceeded its allocated size.
Returns the key to use to render the private view state.
This field is read-only.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This field is used by adapters to render private view state.
For more information, see the [ASP.NET State Management Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) documentation.
To be added.
Gets the query string that accompanied the request.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The property returns any characters in the request that follow the question mark (?) in the URL.
This value can be different from the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.ServerVariables%2A> property.
For devices where a unique file path suffix is inserted into a URL for postback, this property automatically strips out the file path suffix.
For example, if the original query is "/home.aspx?id=john+doe", the value of the QueryStringText property will be "id=john+doe".
A following postback URL could be "/home.aspx?_ufps=20292303920&id=john+doe".
On this last postback, the value of the QueryStringText property will again be "id=john+doe", because the unique suffix will be stripped out.

> [!CAUTION] > If the key portion of the key/value pair stored in the QueryStringText property is the same as the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property of a control on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage> object, the view state and the key/value pair are removed from the QueryStringText property.
The query string that accompanied the request.
Notifies the server control that caused the postback that it should handle an incoming postback event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.RaisePostBackEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to determine whether the control is a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form>.
In that case, the method attempts to locate and call the default event handler from the active mobile Web Form.
Otherwise, the base method is called.
The ASP.NET server control that caused the postback.
This control must implement the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler"></xref> interface.
The postback argument.
Redirects to another mobile page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The URL of the redirect action.
Redirects to a specified mobile page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The URL of the redirect action.
Specifies whether the response should be ended at that point.
The default of the first form of the method is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets a relative URL to the page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A relative URL to the page.
Called after a control is removed from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls*> collection of another control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.RemovedControl%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to determine whether the control is a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form> or a <xref:System.Web.UI.UserControl> before calling the base method.
If the control is a `Form` or a `UserControl`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.Forms%2A> property is set to `null`.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl"></xref> that has been removed.
Sends server control content to a provided <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object, which writes the content to be rendered on the client.
Also stores tracing information about the control if tracing is enabled.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Render%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to call the `Render` method of the control adapter.
The text writer that creates the markup.
Renders server control content and stores tracing information about the control if tracing is enabled.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.RenderControl%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to call the `RenderControl` method of the default control adapter.
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter> to receive control content.
Saves any state information for the page.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This member overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.SavePageStateToPersistenceMedium%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to optimize the state data.

This member overrides <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.StyleSheetTheme%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to prevent themes from being changed from the default.
